instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
got this one in, gives no audio.
no liqued damage as i could see.

everything works except audio

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Do you see any output device on System Preferences??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Does it chime after PRAM reset?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
yes it does a chime after a pram reset but its so soft i need to put my ears on the speaker instead of like normaly you can hear it very clear


it shows internal speakers buidin.

and you can select the volume slider and play a sound.
but cant hear it

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
replaced both audio ic
<CHIP>U6410</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6440</CHIP>

problem solved


thank you again
